text: Empower Retirement is a retirement plan recordkeeping company based in Greenwood Village, Colorado. It is the second-largest retirement plan provider in the US. ==History== Empower was created in 2014 when Great-West Life combined the record-keeping services of Great-West Financial, JPMorgan Chase, and Putnam Investments. Part of Great-West Life & Annuity Insurance Company, Empower Retirement is an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Great-West Lifeco. Empower is led by President and CEO Edmund F. Murphy III. In 2019, Empower Retirement signed a 21-season contract to the naming rights of the Denver Broncos stadium, named Empower Field at Mile High. ==References== Category:Financial services companies of the United States Category:Companies based in Greenwood Village, Colorado Category:American subsidiaries of foreign companies Category:Financial services companies established in 2014 Category:Retirement plans in the United States
